reviews.review_msg: Taken in intersession format. Your grade will largely depend on the quality of your group members, completion grades for homework, and a dice roll. You can try seeking clarification with the TA on the dice roll element of your grade. You will not get a satisfactory answer. Advice: Join a group whenever possible and pull your own weight.

As an intersession course, it was pretty brutal. Heavy lean towards group work, so try to pick group members you trust to really help you. The grading is done by TAs so make sure you visit them during office hours to see exactly what they're expecting, it really depends which TA you get. Lots of discussion in groups during the online session.

Good - The course is graded very leniently. Bad - 60% of your grade comes from two group projects. Choose groupmates wisely! I DO NOT RECOMMEND taking this course in the intersession format. It is too rushed and there is not enough time to work on the projects, especially if you have a bad group.

Although the class is easy with Dr. Wang, her teaching style is incredibly frustrating. She makes you do 90% of the work in groups and makes you do 3 presentations over the course of the semester. I believe this is done out of laziness because as a result of all the presentations, she hardly has to teach the class herself. VERY BORING.

Got >95% on both exams but end up not getting an A which is at least 90% of total mark. The marking criteria of the final assignment and the presentation are not clear which can easily drop your grade.
easy to pass and easy to get great marks, I even do not need to do besides two assignment

she was not very clear in explaining her materials. She couldn't teach at all. She seemed not very clear about what she's teaching and explaining the concepts. It has  research participation credits, which couldn't be obtained until the end of semester! Horrible.
prof with no passion in teaching. she doesn't teach!!   she just wants students to be an RA in her lab :( manipulative!

Worst professor in the department, hands down! She cannot teach, doesn't express herself clearly, shows no interest in students' learning needs- basically one of those professors whose main ambition is to do research and teaching is just required of her in order to continue getting funding for her projects. Advice: avoid her classes if you can!

Barely taught any of the course herself, relied on student led discussions to fill the time. Was very unclear in what she wanted out of certain assignments. The few lectures she did actually teach herself were incredibly boring even when the most interesting topics were being discussed.Avoid her if you have an interest in neuroling, she'll kill it.

Although not the most comprehensible instructor, everything's relatively easy to follow and learn. Go to all the classes, take notes, review them and you'll do fine. It's sad how someone thinks it's the teachers' problem that they received a bad grade. Her course is pretty easy, and if you don't attend class 'cuz of her accent, that's your problem.

If you have good memory, the course will be a breeze. Her exams are fairly straight forward. However, an A+ is 96% and she does not curve. She stubbornly refuses to put up notes beforehand though, even when asked by students. She also has major, MAJOR issues with talking in class (who can blame them? Her way of presenting is boring).

Boringboringboring course. Took it as a GPA booster but this prof was so boring and bad at teaching that I skipped half the courses. She can't pronounce a lot of words, and mumbles, making her hard to understand. Students talk during class and a STUDENT HELPER/TA of hers emailed everyone asking us to stop... How sad.

2 MT + final. Study her lec notes. And read the text. Her lecs were ridiculous to go to since she was spilling word for word from the lec slides. Midterms were very doable. Not accumulative but final is. Final was a little brutal. She said 25% on old material & 75% on the stuff that was taught after MT2. But felt like 50/50 instead. Got an A-.

Took the course in 1084. Mainly uses WaveSurfer. Participation and two lab assignments = 25% grade given to you. Take home exam is brutal, make sure you use the two week time she provides. Not an exam where an all-nighter is sufficient. Presentation & paper, and a midterm. No final exam. She's an approachable and nice lady!
THe instructor is generous and she tries her best to teach the course. However, if you are taking this course as mark booster PLEASE DONT TAKE IT!!!
A very good teacher concerning students' learning status

Wang may not be a native speaker, but she's fairly generous with her grades. 330 was mainly about learning to use WaveSurfer and read spectrograms, etc., so if you understand that, you'll get at least a B in this class. She's a sweet, very caring lady too!

Do not take her.She is not a native speaker, and has a difficult time pronouncing the words/sounds, and then she tests you on the words that aren't even pronounced correctly. Guess what, she will mark it incorrect too.She acts nice, but is stern with her marking.How can u teach English/linguistics if you can't even speak the language properly?hmmm
She is very kind and understanding teacher. As long as you attend every classes and participate fully then it should be pretty easy.If you want to take ling 130, I totally recommend her!

A very helpful and friendly prof who is obviously very keen about her field! Has well organized lectures including slides (notes available online). Takes student feedback into consideration by modifying the course. Funny and enjoyable, makes learning the material interesting and attainable! Definitely one of the Linguistic faculties BEST! Try her!
Projects can be time-consuming. Tests are alright, just need to familiarize yourself with symbols and terminologies. Go to every class! She doesn't like ppl who skip...

An easy course, but you must go to every class and will do better if you are good at English. Extremely boring teacher with hard midterms, but projects are VERY easy. This course is pretty easy, but its very hard to pay attn because she is so boring. Last but not least, do NOT turn on your cellphone!!! She will go nuts.

I love her, she is really nice and helpful! You might not her constant pausing in a sentence, but she is a great prof...I would totally recommend anyone who wants to or have to take ling 130 to take her class....Her presentations are fun as well!!!
Good class!!
very boring class.. some questions on exams are totally not expected.. some assignments are meaningless/irrelivant
Nice and very helpful. She uses very organized powerpoints so you don't even have to read the textbook. Ling 130 is a hard course but with this prof it's not too bad.
Well, she made Ling 130 difficult... perhaps that's because she used a combination of Ling 130 and Ling 330's materials.

One of the nicest prof @ SFU. Focused way too much on review of L130 (felt like I was in L130 again). Projects seemed to easy/irrelevent to course. Midterm focused on irrelevent topics (L130, not L330 material). Very nice,helpful and knowledgable in speech science topics.  :)
boring prof & uselesss lectures. didn't prepare us well at all for the midterms. assignments should be weighted more cuz they are quite time consuming.....

Very nice and helpful in class as well as office hour. She uses powerpoint to explain her lecture. If you study her powerpoint note, at least, you will pass her course without any problem. Make sure that you do not eat food or listen to celluar phone. she does not like it.
she doesn't know how to teach, but she tries hard and is nice. the class is super boring and dry, and she just makes it ten times worse.
Nice pro! really helpful and organized
